items.title: VI Live: Wijnaldum drukt stempel met dubbelslag tegen Al-Nassr
items.summary: Dinsdag gaat het weer los in de Premier League. Koploper Arsenal ontvangt Aston Villa, dat zich lijkt te gaan mengen in de titelstrijd, en Manchester United neemt het op tegen hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers. Op de Afrika Cup zijn vier potjes, en in Schotland zetten Celtic en Rangers hun achtervolging op koploper Heart of Midlothian voort. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van dinsdag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Chelsea v Bournemouth, Manchester United v Wolves, and more: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates, kicking off from 7.30pm GMT ‚öΩ Live scores | Follow us on Bluesky | And email Billy ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt fathom why Semenyo is going to City,‚Äù writes Dean Kinsella. ‚ÄúMy bet is he will become yet another attacking forward who will be encouraged to stay out wide and should he happen to beat his full back to turn around and pass the ball back to his midfield. All the dynamic flair having been sucked out of him, soon reduced to playing bit parts from the bench.‚Äù Well, I‚Äôm not sure Pep Guardiola has coached the dynamic flair out of J√©r√©my Doku or Rayan Cherki yet. items.title: De ster van Ekitike begint te stralen bij Liverpool
items.summary: De 2-1 overwinning op Wolverhampton Wanderers was de derde zege op rij voor Liverpool in de Premier League. Hugo Ekitik√© had een grote rol bij het stuk¬≠spelen van de defensie.

items.title: Toen Deventer uitliep voor Go Ahead: 'Mooiste moment van het jaar'
items.summary: Het winnen van de KNVB Beker was dit jaar het hoogtepunt voor Go Ahead Eagles, maar de spelers genoten twee dagen daarna misschien nog wel meer. Toen reed de spelersgroep in een open bus langs de IJssel in Deventer.

items.title: Veelbesproken Hartman ontbreekt in wedstrijdselectie Burnley
items.summary: Burnley speelt dinsdagavond thuis tegen Newcastle United, maar doet dat zonder Quilindschy Hartman. De linksback zit om niet bij de selectie.

items.title: Arsenal v Aston Villa: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 8.15pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Follow us on Bluesky | And email Scott It‚Äôs beginning to look a lot like Christmas a three-way title race ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ and while few at the start of the season would have identified one of the protagonists as Aston Villa, here we are. Since losing at Anfield at the start of November, Unai Emery‚Äôs side have gone on a remarkable run, winning 11 matches in a row, eight of those in the Premier League. One of those wins came at the expense of Arsenal 24 days ago, so they‚Äôll head to the Emirates tonight full of confidence, hoping to complete a third league double over their hosts in six seasons. The Lions are purring. Continue reading...

items.title: Uganda 1-3 Nigeria: Africa Cup of Nations 2025 ‚Äì as it happened
items.summary: Raphael Onyedika scored twice to help Nigeria through with a 100% record against 10-man Uganda, who are out 6 min: Uganda have started well here. Mutyaba, wearing the No 10 shirt, is popping it around with a lot of confidence. 4 min: An early booking for Calvin Bassey, who rugby tackles Ikpeazu to the ground, with the Uganda striker threatening to run through on goal. That is going to be some tussle ‚Äì Bassey and Ikpeazu are both absolute units. From the resulting free-kick, Mato wastes the chance for Uganda with something that was neither a cross nor a shot. Continue reading...

items.title: Transfer Boussaid naar Griekenland is officieel
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Man City close to agreeing terms with Semenyo
items.summary: Manchester City are close to agreeing terms with Bournemouth to sign Antoine Semenyo for ¬£65m.

items.title: Semenyo starts for Bournemouth at Chelsea, who make five changes LIVE!
Welbeck starts for Brighton at West Ham, who bring in Wilson LIVE!
Hamilton players threaten no-show after pay delay
items.summary: Hamilton Academical players are considering refusing to play Saturday's Scottish League 1 match against East Fife if they are not paid on time.

items.title: West Ham prepare bid to sign ¬£40m-rated J√∏rgen Strand Larsen from Wolves
items.summary: Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo has made Norwegian priority target Wolves forward has struggled at Molineux this season West Ham are preparing an opening offer for the Wolves striker J√∏rgen Strand Larsen as they look to boost their survival hopes. Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo, whose side are at major risk of relegation, wants attacking reinforcements during the January transfer window and has identified Strand Larsen as a priority target. It is believed that Wolves want as much as ¬£40m for the Norwegian, who has scored only three goals for the Premier League‚Äôs bottom club this season. Continue reading...

items.title: Premier League summer transfer overperformers: Madueke, Xhaka lead the way
items.summary: Some of last summer's transfers have been vital for their clubs. Here are the 10 players who have most impressed.

items.title: From Liverpool to Chelsea, ranking 8 Premier League clubs' transfer needs
items.summary: Let's look at which Premier League teams need to make moves to improve for the rest of the season.

items.title: Hood's record-breaking win knocks out Rock as Clayton avoids upset
items.summary: Justin Hood produced one of the greatest performances at the World Darts Championship by hitting 11 consecutive doubles without missing on his way to a 4-0 win over Josh Rock in the last 16.

items.title: 'Alarm bells should be ringing' over England tickets
items.summary: A fan group says "alarm bells should be ringing at Fifa" at England fans not taking up their full allocation for the World Cup final and semi-final.

items.title: England group warns FIFA: WC fans priced out
items.summary: A fans' group says "alarm bells should be ringing" at FIFA with England's fans having failed to take up their full ticket allocation for next summer's World Cup final.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.
